trans-unit.source: Provides a calendar adapter class for the WML device adapter set.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The WML calendar adapter uses secondary UI features to render a calendar control over multiple screens.
Creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlCalendarAdapter"></xref> class.
Returns a strongly typed reference to the associated control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A strongly typed reference to the associated control.
Returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the event was handled.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Name of the event.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the event was handled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Loads the view state.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The current view state.
Called after an object, such as a form or a page, is initialized.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An object (defined by <xref:System.EventArgs>) that contains event data.
Loads data that pertains to a control, a page, or a device adapter.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An object (defined by <xref:System.EventArgs>) that contains event data.
Called by the control's OnPreRender method, to perform adapter-specific work prior to rendering.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An object (defined by <xref:System.EventArgs>) that contains event data.
Generates the target-specific markup for the associated control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The text writer to receive output.
Called when the control saves its private view state.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_Null" name="Null" href=""></xref> in all cases.
